name: Wrong Title - Children's TV Edition Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Biker Mice from Mars" can't be right? The show is about four mutated turtles that down pizza and practice ninjitsu.
questions.explanation:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

	"Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" comics were first created in 1984. Since that time they have become a worldwide success on TV, in the movies, video games and all other forms of mass media.

questions.text: "The Brothers Grimm" isn't right. What is this show about a pair of mice who continually plot to take over the world.
questions.explanation:
Pinky & The Brain.

	"Pinky & The Brain" was produced by Steven Spielberg. The show was originally broadcast in the US from 1995 to 1998.

questions.text: "Blue's Clues" isn't really about a guy who lives in an undersea pineapple is it?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The correct show here is "SpongeBob SquarePants." The show debuted in 1999, and has had two theatrically released films spun off of it.

questions.text: "The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius" can't possibly be about the police officer with a ton of robotic features. What show am I actually watching?
questions.explanation:
Inspector Gadget.

	"Inspector Gadget" was about a police detective, or inspector, who had a million and one gadgets to help him solve crimes. Due to his follies his niece Penny and pet dog Brain ended up solving most of his cases.

questions.text: "Beetleborgs" isn't right. Now I'm watching a show that has five (and later six) costumed superheros that fight against the forces of evil based on the moon.
questions.explanation:
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers.

	The original "Power Rangers" show began airing in the United States in 1994 and has spawned more than 15 sequels and spin offs. The original rangers used Zords that drew their power from ancient dinosaurs.

questions.text: "Sesame Street" features Big Bird, Oscar and Bert and Ernie.
questions.explanation:
True.

	The show debuted on government owned PBS in the United States in 1968. Over the 40 plus years it was on the air, some of the finest voice actors of their generation provided life to the muppet characters on the show. These actors included Frank Oz, Kevin Clash, and Jerry Nelson among others.

questions.text: "Gargoyles" is all about a group of alien robots in disguise isn't it? No, then what show am I watching?
questions.explanation:
Transformers.

	"Transformers" spawned a series of live-action movies, comic books, and more animated TV series after debuting on the air in 1984. The original animated show was actually based on a toy line produced by Hasbro.

questions.text: Now I think I'll watch "The Backyardigans." It's my favorite show about a monkey and his caretaker in a yellow hat. Wait, that's not the name of the show. What is?
questions.explanation:
Curious George.

	"Curious George" was originally based on a series of books that were written to help children learn how to read. The first animated show about him debuted in 2006, though a series of made-for-TV movies and animated shorts were produced in the 1980s and 90s.

questions.text: Next up on my viewing party is "Justice League Unlimited," a show featuring a mutated man who was bitten by a spider, a giant lizard and a man with eight appendages. Blast, got the title wrong again. Which show am I actually watching?
questions.explanation:
Spider-Man.

	"Spider-Man" was one of the huge commercial and critical successes for both Marvel and DC Comics in the early 1990s. The show spawned several sequels and spin-off series through cameo appearances and cross appearances on other shows.

questions.text: I think I'm watching a show called "Beakman's World," but they keep calling the main scientist by the name Bill. What show am I actually watching?
questions.explanation:
Bill Nye the Science Guy.

	"Beakman's World" and Bill Nye's show both aired in the early to mid 1990s as first run episodes. They both followed "Mr. Wizard," after its star retired from entertainment. All three shows had experiments and other science projects that children could replicate at home after watching the show.
